t: Woe to Those Who Go Down to Egypt

Woe*pn to those who go down to Egypt for help and*ld rely on horses, who*ln trust in chariots because they are many and*ld in horsemen because they are very strong, but*ln do not look to the Holy One of Israel or*ld consult the Lord!*s
And*ln yet he is wise and brings disaster; he*ld does not call back his words, but*ln will arise against the house of the evildoers and*ld against the helpers of those who work iniquity.

The*ln Egyptians are man, and not God, and*ld their horses are flesh, and not spirit. When*ln the Lord*s stretches out his hand, the*ld helper will stumble, and he who is helped will fall, and*ld they will all perish together.

For*pn thus the Lord*s said to me, “As*ln a lion or a young lion growls over his prey, and*ld when a band of shepherds is called out against him he*ln is not terrified by their shouting or*ld daunted at their noise, so*ln the Lord*s of hosts will come down to*ld fight on Mount Zion and on its hill.
Like*ln birds hovering, so the Lord*s of hosts will*ld protect Jerusalem; he*ln will protect and deliver it; he*ld will spare and rescue it.”
Turn*p to him from whom people have deeply revolted, O children of Israel.
For in that day everyone shall cast away his idols of silver and his idols of gold, which your hands have sinfully made for you.
“And*pn the Assyrian shall fall by a sword, not of man; and*ld a sword, not of man, shall devour him; and*ln he shall flee from the sword, and*ld his young men shall be put to forced labor.
His*ln rock shall pass away in terror, and*ld his officers desert the standard in panic,” declares*ln the Lord,*s whose fire is in Zion, and*ld whose furnace is in Jerusalem.
